bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, November 18, 1902

div1.p: Howard wants to borrow a photograph of Lazear from Carroll in order to have a slide made. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, November 18, 1902
div1.p:
Dr. Thayer writes me that the last picture of
Lazier has been sent by Dr. Paton to Mrs. Lazier in California, but
he has written for it and ought to have it before long. In the
meantime, I think you told me that you had a photograph other than
the one which you had already loaned me--that is to say a single
professional one of Lazier. If so, will you loan it to me long
enough to have a slide made.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard Dr. James Carroll,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
ht
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
[unclear]
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE
